DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare medical efficacy cost effectiveness two surgical option obstructive BPH management : transurethral resection prostate photo selective vaporization prostate use high power 532nm laser .
DOC.brief_title: TRP Versus Photo Selective Vaporization Obstructive Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia Management
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study compare medical efficacy cost effectiveness two surgical option obstructive BPH management : transurethral resection prostate photo selective vaporization prostate use high power 532nm laser . Patients randomize two group inclusion . Perioperative data collect , follow-up conduct one month .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male , 50 year age old . 2 . American Society Anesthesiology ( ASA ) classification physical status , class 13 3 . Signed informed consent begin study . 4 . Patients present LUTS associate benign prostatic enlargement 3 month , need surgical management , least one follow situation : disability score ≥3 , IPSS ≥12 , full urinary retention 5 . Qmax ≤12ml /s drain patient voided volume > 125 ml . 6 . Estimated prostate weight 25g 80g 7 . Patient free catheter PVR ≤ 300cc 8 . Patient without renal disorder . 9 . No prostate cancer suspicion clinical examination , include DRE . 10 . PSA ≤ 10 ng/ml , negative prostate biopsy PSA 4 10 ng/mL patient 75 year young life expectancy 10 year . 11 . In case anticoagulation antiaggregation therapy , necessary preoperative visit anaesthesiologist determine supply therapy around surgery . 12 . In case current BPH medical management , alpha blocker herbal medicine stop one week surgery 5alphareductaseinhibitors stop one month surgery . 13 . Patient must affiliate French social healthcare equivalent 1 . Uncontrolled cardiopulmonary disorder , previously recently diagnose standard method 2 . Assessed sphincter detrusor dyssynergia , myasthenia , multiple sclerosis , Parkinson disease . 3 . History pelvic lesion abdominal sphincter injury . 4 . Urinary tract infection without antibiotic . 5 . Patient urinary catheter suprapubic catheter acute urinary retention link alternative diagnosis impair bladder sensation . 6 . Subject neurogenic bladder and/or sphincter abnormalities 7 . Subject confirm suspected malignancy prostate bladder . 8 . Previous prostatic surgery . 9 . History bladder stone , major hematuria , urethral stricture , bladder neck stenosis . 10 . Patient prosthesis procedure area 11 . Patient active anorectal disease 12 . Treatment emergency 13 . Individual unable respect time visit determine protocol . 14 . Constitutional hemostasis coagulation abnormality link oral medication 15 . Any disease patient condition contra indication enrolment study , accord investigator .
